attributes.action: MPs, who ignored the majority of their constituents’ votes, to lose their seats.
attributes.background: In the 2016 referendum 406 constituencies voted to leave and 242 to remain. In the House of Commons only 160 MPs voted to leave whereas 486 voted to remain. All those MPs, who flagrantly disregarded the votes of their constituents, should be deselected,

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for removing MP's from office due to their views or opinions. 

You could ask your own MP to vote according to the result of referendum in your constituency. You can find out who your MP is and how to contact them here: 

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/ 


You might like to sign this petition if you would like MPs to be subject to recall petitions from constituents:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/268854
